newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia govt says labour market still weak.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia govt says labour market still weak.

text.p: Australian Employment Minister Amanda Vanstone said on Thursday October labour force data showed the labour market was still weak but that Wednesday's interest rate should help boost jobs growth.
"While the labour market is still relatively weak, trend employment has been rising for the last six months and is now at its highest ever level," Vanstone said in a statement.
"Yesterday's interest rate reduction should provide a further boost to the labour market, though it may take sometime for this to flow through," she said.
The seasonally adjusted unemployment rate rose to 8.8 percent in October from 8.7 percent in September and 8.6 percent in October last year.
Australia's seasonally adjusted estimate of the number of employed persons rose 25,500 in October to 8.37 million, against 8.35 million in September and 8.24 million a year earlier.
Economists had on average expected employment to rise around 12,000 in October, seasonally-adjusted, with the unemployment rate steady at 8.7 percent.
The Reserve Bank of Australia on Wednesday cut official cash interest rates by half a percentage point to 6.5 percent, saying the decision was in response to low inflation and wage restraint.
